PAD_TooHeavy.synopsis: Player's trying to lift the beams off the half-elf, has previously failed the skill check, and cannot enter interactive dialogue. There is no cutscene or animation - you lift it or you don't - the half-elf is just suddenly free. In this PAD they failed the check and can't lift it.
PAD_TooHeavy.how_to_trigger: There is no animation or interactive dialogue for this - you just click on the beam and you lift it or you don't.

AD.synopsis: This AD plays when Benryn is stuck beneath a fallen beam within a burning building. He is crying out for help - but coughing as he does so, as the building is still on fire.

individual_metadata.synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -82.25, 43.56, 612.254. Talk to Benryn.

PAD_FoundWife.synopsis: This VB plays when players near the body of Benryn's wife, Mirileth. Benryn has told them what she looks like - brown hair, green dress - and this body fits the description.

AD_FoundWife.synopsis: Benryn has been freed from a burning inn after becoming trapped during a drow/goblin attack. He's just found his wife's body. He'd been holding out hope that she was still alive.

AD_Searching.synopsis: Benryn is searching for his wife in the wreckage left behind by a goblin attack on an inn. She's dead, but he doesn't know it yet.He's on the edge of total panic, but keeping it together enough to try to find her.

AD_ToWife.synopsis: This AD plays after the player has told Benryn where he can find his wife's body. He doesn't want to believe it, but he knows it is probably true. If the corpse has been moved after players tell him where he can find her, he has a spark of hope - she's not there, so perhaps she is still alive after all.

Freed.synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.
Freed.how_to_trigger:
loadlevel WLD_Main_A 

goto -64.39, 37.44, 607.51 

Destroy the Blocked Door (Ctrl Shift K) 

Go up the stairs and open door (god mode help a lot to avoid dying from fire)

roll amazing

Save HalfElve under the pillar 

excort him outside the building

The corps of his love is → goto -85 601

To get the Dowry:

CTRL + Left click on character

SetCharacterOsirisFlag PLA_StuckHalfElf_State_HasDowry

PAD_FoundChest.synopsis: An AD that plays when you notice the dowry in the stack of hay.

TryJoinParty.synopsis:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.

AD_Rescued.synopsis: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.

AD_Freed.synopsis: This AD plays after the player has freed Benryn from beneath a fallen beam. The building they're in is burning around them - he's desperate to escape.

PAD_Door.synopsis: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.

AD_Escaping.synopsis: This AD plays after Benryn has been rescued and has subsequently joined the party. They are within a  burning building. Once players safely exit the building, Benryn leaves the party and further dialogues become available.In this dialogue, Benryn is

automatic_ordering.reasoning:
There appear to be two main branches in this set of sessions. One branch is the success/rescue branch, where the player successfully frees Benryn from under the beam and then goes through a series of dialogues concerning his rescue, his shock at the aftermath, and his desperate search for his wife. The other branch is the failure branch, represented by PAD_TooHeavy – when the player fails the strength check (or similar) and cannot free him. In addition, there is a duplicated‐narrative style in two sessions (the unnamed session and TryJoinParty have nearly identical texts) so it appears only one of them will be encountered; hence they are mutually exclusive. 

Within the rescue branch a rough ordering can be deduced from the dialogue triggers and “how_to_trigger” instructions. For example, the initial encounter dialogue (the unnamed session, where Benryn is first found trapped) must occur before the actual physical rescue (represented by the Freed session). Immediately after physically freeing him (Freed) the rescue-specific AD (AD_Freed) is played as the building is still burning. Once the party exits the building, a post‐rescue AD (AD_Rescued) is triggered, and then subsequently, while outside and after the shock sets in, Benryn begins searching for his wife. That search is represented by AD_Searching; once the player tells him where to look, AD_ToWife is triggered, and then when the wife’s body is actually discovered the dialogue splits into a visual (PAD_FoundWife) and an audio/dialogue (AD_FoundWife) session. In a similar vein, a separate AD (PAD_FoundChest) is mentioned that plays when the dowry chest is noticed. (PAD_Door is a warning dialogue that appears to be triggered by an environmental hazard and does not appear to be tied to the Benryn chain.) 

Because the failure branch (PAD_TooHeavy) is a dead‐end – once it is triggered, all of the rescue dialogue sessions will be off–path – it must be mutually exclusive with the entire rescue branch. Also, the unnamed session and TryJoinParty look like two alternative ways to handle the initial encounter dialogue – meaning only one of them should occur in any given playthrough. 

The following JSON lists order rules only for those sessions that have logical sequencing and marks the mutually exclusive sessions.

PAD_TooHeavy_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: You click on the beam and you lift it or you don't (there is no animation or cut scene) so maybe mocap of the player's face looking frustrated...?NodeContext: You've just tried to life something and it's too heavy for you.

1.speaker: Benryn
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stuck under wooden beamNodeContext: Coughing. He's pasing out. The room is full of smoke, and he's given up.

24.speaker: Benryn
24.text: The fire - hurry! Get this thing off of me!
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stuck under wooden beamNodeContext: Panicking, wheezing/coughing

18.speaker: Player
18.text: This wreckage is no challenge - cast it aside.

32.speaker: Benryn
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimaces and aggressively flips the beam right off Benryn. It falls away off-screen.NodeContext: Surprised and elated (player freed him from wreckage)

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Brace yourself to lift the wreckage.

30.speaker: Benryn
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts the beam a couple of inches. He rolls out from under the beam on "There". Player drops it after he's free.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You will not be beaten. Try harder - lift.

25.speaker: Benryn
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barbarian player aggressively yanks at the wreckage, There's creaking from overhead, then some more wreckage collapses on Benryn, killing him.InternalNodeContext: This node if the barbarian fails their second strength check and Benryn dies.NodeContext: Alarmed, then a shout of terror as a barbarian accidentally causes wreckage to crush him dead

19.speaker: Benryn
19.text: Damn... just go. I'm done for.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The beam doesn't budge.NodeContext: Resigned.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Pretend the beam is too heavy to lift.

23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bard player dramatically struggles (not really) with the fallen beam, trying several different heroic poses to shift it.

33.speaker: Benryn
33.text: Oh gods, keep trying! My wife, Miri, she'll need my help!

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Actually try to shift the beam.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: It's stuck fast. I'll help your wife. Where is she?

45.speaker: Benryn
45.text: Miri... We fought. She left with the dowry. She must be nearby. Please, find her, try and help.

8.speaker: Benryn
8.text: Damn... just go. I'm done for.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The beam doesn't budge.NodeContext: Resigned.

27.speaker: Benryn
27.text: Look, are you actually going to help or just piss about?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Find leverage to shift the beam.

0.speaker: Benryn
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pushes against the beam. Benryn wriggles out and stands.

4.speaker: Benryn
4.text: Damn... just go. I'm done for.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The beam doesn't budge.NodeContext: Resigned.

PAD_FoundWife_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundWife_0.text: Green blouse, brown hair - that must be Miri.
PAD_FoundWife_0.context: NodeContext: Names pronounced Ben-rin and MIH-ree

PAD_FoundWife_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundWife_1.context: NodeContext: Names pronounced Ben-rin and Mih-rih

AD_FoundWife_0.speaker: Benryn
AD_FoundWife_0.context: NodeContext: Benryn has found his wife's body. He's absolutely devastated - he was afraid she had been killed, but he was holding out hope.

AD_Searching_3.speaker: Benryn
AD_Searching_3.text: She's alive. I know she is.

AD_ToWife_0.speaker: Benryn
AD_ToWife_0.text: She's not here. Maybe she's all right.
AD_ToWife_0.context: NodeContext: Hopeful, but not entierly convinced.

Freed_30.speaker: Player
Freed_30.text: Can you tell me what she looks like?

Freed_63.speaker: Benryn
Freed_63.text: I have to keep looking. Miri!

Freed_59.speaker: Benryn
Freed_59.text: Miri, no... gods, no, no, no!

Freed_112.speaker: Benryn
Freed_112.text: You should've stayed... you should've been with me.
Freed_112.context: NodeContext: Speaking to his dead wife's body.

Freed_67.speaker: Player
Freed_67.text: How did you two get separated?

Freed_42.speaker: Benryn
Freed_42.text: I was in our room. We had a fight.

Freed_45.speaker: Benryn
Freed_45.text: If I'd just kept my mouth shut about that bloody dowry, she'd... she'd still be here.
Freed_45.context: NodeContext: He's explaining a stupid argument he and his wife had that led to her storming outside, where she was killed by goblins.

Freed_52.speaker: Player
Freed_52.text: About that dowry - pretty sure I found it.

Freed_58.speaker: Benryn
Freed_58.text: You did? Please - she'd want her sister to have it.
Freed_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Extends hand - 'Give it to me'.NodeContext: Player retrieved the dowry. He's surprised, but not suspicious. He's asking the players to hand it over.

Freed_25.speaker: Benryn
Freed_25.text: Maybe I judged you too quickly. Thank you.

Freed_80.speaker: Benryn
Freed_80.text: I'd need some time alone with her... to say goodbye.

Freed_81.speaker: Benryn
Freed_81.text: I know this doesn't change anything, but it helps. Thank you.

Freed_51.speaker: Player
Freed_51.text: I'm keeping it. Consider it payment for saving your life.

Freed_77.speaker: Benryn
Freed_77.text: Fine. I hope you choke on it.

Freed_62.speaker: Lae'zel
Freed_62.text: What's a few coins? The sister won't miss them.

Freed_110.speaker: Shadowheart
Freed_110.text: He can afford it - he's got one less mouth to feed now.

Freed_55.speaker: Astarion
Freed_55.text: You took the gold? I was rather hoping for the body...

Freed_21.speaker: Gale
Freed_21.text: Allow me to apologise on Lae'zel's behalf, sir. Her lack of tact is a burden to us all.

Freed_119.speaker: Gale
Freed_119.text: Allow me to apologise on Shadowheart's behalf, sir. Her lack of tact is a burden to us all.

Freed_37.speaker: Gale
Freed_37.text: Allow me to apologise on Astarion's behalf, sir. His lack of tact is a burden to us all.

Freed_90.speaker: Karlach
Freed_90.context: NodeContext: Incredulous at the player's villainy

Freed_47.speaker: Wyll
Freed_47.text: By the hells' fires, has your heart shrunk so small?

Freed_53.speaker: Gale
Freed_53.text: That was a rather unimpressive display of pettiness, if you ask me.

Freed_86.speaker: Karlach
Freed_86.text: I ought to smack some manners into you, you know that?
Freed_86.context: NodeContext: Annoyed but not too mad

Freed_84.speaker: Player
Freed_84.text: Sorry, but I don't have it anymore.

Freed_102.speaker: Benryn
Freed_102.text: Then get it back! I'm sorry, it's just... it's important.
Freed_102.context: NodeContext: Starts angry, but collects himself quickly.

Freed_32.speaker: Benryn
Freed_32.text: Please, it'd mean so much to her.

Freed_66.speaker: Player
Freed_66.text: About that dowry - I know where it is.

Freed_48.speaker: Benryn
Freed_48.text: You do? Please, can you return it to me? She'd want her sister to have it.

Freed_9.speaker: Player
Freed_9.text: What was that about a dowry?

Freed_95.speaker: Benryn
Freed_95.text: It's for her sister's wedding. I made a stupid joke about keeping it.

Freed_111.speaker: Benryn
Freed_111.text: We argued about it for hours. Then she took the dowry and left.

Freed_41.speaker: Benryn
Freed_41.text: She said I'd never see her again. She was right.

Freed_75.speaker: Player
Freed_75.text: I think I found the dowry.

Freed_18.speaker: Player
Freed_18.text: This isn't on you. There was no way you could have known.

Freed_121.speaker: Benryn
Freed_121.text: I'm sorry, Miri. I'm so sorry.

Freed_31.speaker: Benryn
Freed_31.text: Please, just go. I need a moment with her.

Freed_35.speaker: Player
Freed_35.text: Count your blessings. At least you're still alive.

Freed_24.speaker: Player
Freed_24.text: She was trying to get back to you.

Freed_88.speaker: Benryn
Freed_88.text: No. No! Why didn't you run? Why didn't you hide?
Freed_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Mirileth's corpse.NodeContext: Talking to his dead wife.

Freed_103.speaker: Benryn
Freed_103.text: This is all my fault. We were arguing. She ran off.

Freed_40.speaker: Player
Freed_40.text: It wouldn't have made a difference.

Freed_83.speaker: Benryn
Freed_83.text: She would've survived! If only I'd kept my mouth shut about that bloody dowry...

Freed_13.speaker: Benryn
Freed_13.text: What am I going to do? She's all I had.

Freed_60.speaker: Player
Freed_60.text: You'll be all right, with time.

Freed_10.speaker: Player
Freed_10.text: I can pray for her, if you like.

Freed_72.speaker: Player
Freed_72.text: I pray to thee, Gond - guide Miri to peace in death.

Freed_97.speaker: Benryn
Freed_97.text: Thank you. She would've like that.

Freed_14.speaker: Player
Freed_14.text: Pray to your own god instead.

Freed_69.speaker: Benryn
Freed_69.text: That's... thank you. I hope your god listens.

Freed_94.speaker: Benryn
Freed_94.text: The gods won't listen to me. It's my fault she's dead.
Freed_94.context: NodeContext: After players pray for his dead wife. He thinks the gods would ignore his prayers, because he might as well have killer her himself.

Freed_38.speaker: Benryn
Freed_38.text: Her body's not even cold and you're questioning her faith?

Freed_93.speaker: Benryn
Freed_93.context: NodeContext: The player was a jerk to him about his dead wife. He's pissed.

Freed_23.speaker: Player
Freed_23.text: Didn't you say something about a dowry?

Freed_106.speaker: Player
Freed_106.text: I found this chest - I think it's yours.

Freed_104.speaker: Benryn
Freed_104.text: I won't forget what you did for me. For her. Thank you.

Freed_116.speaker: Benryn
Freed_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks around at the wreckage and the bodies.NodeContext: Initially in shock, before the thought of his wife breaks him out of it.

Freed_73.speaker: Player
Freed_73.text: Miri? Who are you looking for?

Freed_43.speaker: Benryn
Freed_43.text: My wife. She was outside when the goblins came.

Freed_120.speaker: Benryn
Freed_120.text: She was wearing a green blouse. Brown hair, about this tall.
Freed_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds his hand about the same height as himself.

Freed_82.speaker: Player
Freed_82.text: Sorry, I haven't. But I can look for her.

Freed_4.speaker: Benryn
Freed_4.text: Thank you. She can't have gone far.

Freed_114.speaker: Benryn
Freed_114.text: No. No, it can't be. I need to see.

Freed_78.speaker: Player
Freed_78.text: Save your breath. There aren't any survivors.

Freed_46.speaker: Player
Freed_46.text: She's dead. I found her body in one of the burned buildings.

PAD_FoundChest_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundChest_0.text: Looks like there's a chest buried in that hay.

PAD_FoundChest_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundChest_1.text: Surprised this hay hasn't gone up in flames yet.

TryJoinParty_3.speaker: Benryn
TryJoinParty_3.text: Thank you... now how the hell do we get out of here?
TryJoinParty_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stuck under debris.NodeContext: Coughing. He's pasing out. The room is full of smoke, and he's given up.

TryJoinParty_1.speaker: Benryn
TryJoinParty_1.text: The smoke - I can't see a damn thing!

TryJoinParty_6.speaker: Benryn
TryJoinParty_6.text: Oh, gods. I'll have to make a run for it.

TryJoinParty_0.speaker: Benryn
TryJoinParty_0.text: Right. I'll try to keep up.
TryJoinParty_0.context: NodeContext: Coughing. Responding to the player telling him to follow.

AD_Freed_0.speaker: Benryn
AD_Freed_0.context: NodeContext: He's just barely escaped a burning building with his life, only to emerge into the remains of a bloodbath.

PAD_Door_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Door_0.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

AD_Escaping_1.speaker: Benryn
AD_Escaping_1.text: We're running out of time. Go!
